Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Geshe Thupten Kungkhen of the Drepung Loseling Institute located at 164 Washington Avenue, Brooklyn NY 11205.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Won.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Geshe Thupten Kungkhen of the Drepung Loseling Institute located at 164 Washington Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11205.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Won.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the interest rate applicable to real property with an assessed value of two hundred fifty thousand dollars or less for which the owner of such property has entered into an agreement with the department of finance for the payment in installments of real property taxes, assessments or other charges, and to repeal subdivision (c) of section 11-312 and subdivision (e) of section 11-313 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to written recommendations by the banking commission of a proposed interest rate to be charged for the nonpayment of water rents and sewer rents
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Interest rates applicable to installment agreements for the payment of property tax arrears.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York city police department to provide the civilian complaint review board with direct access to officer body-warn camera footage and to establish related procedures
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the New York city police department to provide the civilian complaint review board with direct access to officer body-warn camera footage and to establish related procedures.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to conduct a biannual study on student access to home internet and electronic devices
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to conduct a biannual study on student access to home internet and electronic devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to adding a 311 complaint category for dog runs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Adding a 311 complaint category for dog runs.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Declaring April as Sikh Awareness and Appreciation Month in New York City.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to establishing an office of child care to oversee free child care for all city residents
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Establishing an office of child care to oversee free child care for all city residents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to minimum standards for emergency congregate housing
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Minimum standards for emergency congregate housing.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to notification of the right to be placed in shelter
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Notification of the right to be placed in shelter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the evaluation of civil actions alleging improper conduct by the police department
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Evaluation of civil actions alleging improper conduct by the New York city police department.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a mental health coordinator to inform city employees about mental health support and services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MatterName: Creating a mental health coordinator to inform city employees about mental health support and services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a technical support program for older adults
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Aging In Place Package - Establishing a technical support program for older adults.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation denying property owners from filing eviction proceedings for tenants who reside in buildings with substantial pending housing maintenance code violations.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Denying property owners from filing eviction proceedings for tenants who reside in buildings with substantial pending housing maintenance code violations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.642/S.1215, which directs the Queens Board of Elections to provide language assistance in Bengali, Punjabi and Hindi.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Directs the Queens Board of Elections to provide language assistance in Bengali, Punjabi and Hindi. (A.642/S.1215)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to report information and data regarding the department operations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the New York City Police Department to report information and data regarding the department operations.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to creating a task force to consider the impact of slavery and past injustices for African Americans in New York city and reparations for such injustices
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Withdrawn by Sponsor
Items.MatterName: Creating a task force to consider the impact of slavery and past injustices for African Americans in New York city and reparations for such injustices.

Items.Title: Resolution to declare June 3 in New York City as World Bicycle Day.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Declare June 3 in New York City as World Bicycle Day.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to create an independent Commission to oversee hospital services pricing for the purpose of increasing access to hospital services, promoting financial stability for hospitals, and lowering healthcare costs for New Yorkers.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Hospitals
Items.MatterName: Create an independent Commission to oversee hospital services pricing for the purpose of increasing access to hospital services, promoting financial stability for hospitals, and lowering healthcare costs for New Yorkers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.183/A.2418, which would amend the Social Services Law to mandate each local department of social service link persons living with HIV with benefits and services and provide that persons living with HIV who are receiving housing assistance shall not be required to pay more than 30% of household income towards shelter costs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Dept of social service link persons living with HIV with benefits and services and provide that persons living with HIV who are receiving housing assistance shall not be required to pay more than 30% of household income towards shelter costs. (S.183/A.241

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a trade-in program for powered mobility devices and lithium-ion batteries used in powered mobility devices, and to provide for the repeal of such local law upon the expiration thereof.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring businesses using bicycles for commercial purposes to provide bicycle operators with fireproof or fire-resistant containers for removable storage batteries used to power motor-assisted bicycles.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Rooftop access requirements for buildings with solar panel installations.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers).


There were 48 Council Members present at thisStated Meeting.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, March  16, 2023.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Orders Calendar and voted separately:

Preconsidered M-125 & Res. No. 516,  VOTE: 46-1-0
Negative: CM Yeger.

Preconsidered M-126 & Res. No. 517,  VOTE: 46-1-0
Negative: CM Yeger.

Int. No. 663-A,  VOTE: 45-1-1
Negative: CM Aviles;
Abstention: CM Barron.

Preconsidered Res. No. 508,  VOTE: 46-0-1
Abstention: CM Yeger.

Preconsidered Res. No. 528,  VOTE: 41-6-0
Negative: CMs Carr, Holden, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Preconsidered Res. No. 529,  VOTE: 39-8-0
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Holden, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Preconsidered L.U. No. 175 & Res. No. 525,  VOTE: 46-1-0
Negative: CM Yeger.



See files for individual votes.
